question: How should the Vue project be migrated to TypeScript?

evidence.summary: Project currently depends on Vue 3 with Vite, no TypeScript related packages installed.
Entry file is JavaScript, implying default template without TS support.

migrationPlan: Add dev dependencies: typescript, vue-tsc, @vue/tsconfig, @vitejs/plugin-vue-jsx (if needed).
Create tsconfig.json extending @vue/tsconfig/tsconfig.json with JSX disabled and strict true.
Rename main.js to main.ts, update imports to typed components, convert components to <script setup lang="ts"> syntax.
Update Vite config to include vue plugin with TypeScript support (already OK).
Introduce ESLint/Prettier? (optional) and adjust package scripts to run vue-tsc --noEmit during build.

remainingUnknowns: Need to confirm if project will adopt options API or composition API across all components.
Determine whether to generate additional typing for backend API client (e.g., Axios).
